skill.name: code-review-assistant
skill.description: Comprehensive PR review using multi-agent swarm with specialized reviewers for security, performance, style, tests, and documentation. Provides detailed feedback with auto-fix suggestions and merge readiness assessment.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PR review using multi-agent swarm with specialized reviewers for security, performance...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Legitimate code review automation skill. Uses GitHub CLI and claude-flow tools to coordinate multi-agent PR reviews. All filesystem operations scoped to temporary review directories. No credential theft, data exfiltration, or persistence mechanisms detected. Static findings are false positives from scanner misinterpreting documentation patterns and metadata.

content.user_title: Review pull requests with AI agents
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are slow and inconsistent. The Code Review Assistant uses a multi-agent swarm to analyze pull requests across security, performance, style, tests, and documentation in parallel, then posts detailed feedback with fix suggestions directly to GitHub.
actual_capabilities: Coordinates 5 specialized AI agents for parallel code review
Analyzes security vulnerabilities, performance bottlenecks, code style, test coverage, and documentation
Posts review comments directly to GitHub pull requests
Generates automatic fix suggestions using Codex reasoning
Calculates overall code quality scores and merge readiness assessment
Approves or requests changes based on quality gates
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI authentication and repository access
Relies on claude-flow tools being available in the environment
Does not execute tests or build code locally

use_cases.title: Automated PR feedback
use_cases.description: Get instant, comprehensive feedback on every pull request without waiting for human reviewers.

use_cases.title: Quality gates for merge
use_cases.description: Enforce code quality standards automatically before merging pull requests to main branches.

use_cases.title: Consistent review standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members receive the same thorough analysis across security, performance, and style.

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Review PR {number} focusing on security vulnerabilities only

prompt_templates.title: Quick quality check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run code-review-assistant {number} with security,performance,tests suggestions enabled

prompt_templates.title: Full audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review PR {number} with all focus areas and auto-merge if score is above 90

output_examples.input: Review PR 123 focusing on security vulnerabilities only
output: Critical: SQL injection in user auth module
Critical: Hardcoded API key in config
Warning: Missing input validation in login form
Fix suggestions generated for all issues

best_practices: Run code reviews early in the development cycle to catch issues before they accumulate
Combine automated reviews with human expertise for best results
Address security findings immediately regardless of overall score
anti_patterns: Ignoring automated reviews and merging without addressing findings
Relying solely on automated reviews without human oversight
Using code review as a gatekeeper rather than a learning opportunity

faq.question: What AI tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for multi-agent coordination.

faq.question: What GitHub permissions are needed?
faq.answer: Requires GitHub CLI authentication with repo read/write access for PR comments.

faq.question: How long does a full review take?
faq.answer: Typical reviews complete in 2-5 minutes depending on PR size and focus areas.

faq.question: Is my code data sent externally?
faq.answer: Code stays within your environment. Only review results are posted to GitHub.

faq.question: What if the review finds critical issues?
faq.answer: Critical security issues block merge and generate detailed fix suggestions immediately.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Provides deeper analysis with AI agents rather than static rule-based checks.
